alert.note: Alert for Orange; Putnam; Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 7:52PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Upton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Orange County in southeastern New York... Western Putnam County in southeastern New York... Rockland County in southeastern New York... Northern Westchester County in southeastern New York... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Peekskill, West Point, Cold Spring, Stony Point, Putnam Valley, Woodbury, West Haverstraw, Thiells, Highland Falls, Cornwall On Hudson, Buchanan and Fort Montgomery. Although there has been a lull in the heavy rain, additional moderate to heavy rain will impact the area this evening. Additional rain may exacerbate ongoing flooding across the area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
